p: Chloroquine, as a drug extensively utilized in anti-malaria and autoimmune diseases, has been found to be a potential broad-spectrum antiviral agent [100]. It can prevent viral infections via elevating the endosomal pH needed for virus-cell fusion and disturbing the glycosylation of SARS-CoV cell receptors [101]. Gao et al. revealed that chloroquine was effective in the therapy of COVID-19-associated pneumonia [102]. Wang and coworkers also conducted in vitro study, and they found that it is an ideal candidate antiviral drug against SARS-CoV-2 infection in Vero E6 cells with EC50 value of around 1 μM [88]. Although several trials had verified that chloroquine suppresses the exacerbation of COVID-19, the optimal dosage of chloroquine will require to be evaluated in future trials [102].
